p: The pathogenicity and severity of IBV are weaker than those of IAV, but the disease burden of IBV is significant, especially among children and young teenagers [ 1]. In a report on mortality related to influenza between 1976 and 1999 in the USA, the highest mortality was associated with H3N2, followed by IBV and then H1N1 [ 2]. During 2003â€“2008, the mortality attributable to IBV was estimated to be higher than that to H3N2 or H1N1 in China [ 3]. Furthermore, influenza B virus caused more complications, including neurological, muscular manifestations [ 4, 5] and cardiologic complications [ 6, 7].
